author.name: Avi Chawla
author.title: Co-founder DailyDoseofDS | IIT Varanasi | ex-AI Engineer MastercardAI | Newsletter (130k+)Co-founder DailyDoseofDS | IIT Varanasi | ex-AI Engineer MastercardAI | Newsletter (130k+)

content: Anyone can build an AI agent today.Only few can do this:Building an agent is only the first step.The real challenge begins when you test it on real-world scenarios, and that too at scale.Traditional unit testing and manual QA checks fall short for these complex, probabilistic systems.Maxim AI is solving this by building an AI-powered simulations and evaluation platform that lets you:‚òë Simulate agent interactions across a range of scenarios and user personas‚òë Measure the quality of agent interactions using predefined and custom metrics‚òë Trace every multi-agent interaction in real-time, right from your dashboard‚òë Debug your agents and set real-time alerts on quality & performance regressionsI have put together a video below that shows some of these capabilities, but Maxim can do a lot more for you.Try it on your own Agentic, multi-turn workflow here: https://lnkd.in/gGrM6jxE.All you need is an endpoint where your application is deployed; Maxim takes it from there.Thanks to Maxim for partnering on today's post.

comments.content: This is a great insight into the real challenges of AI agent development! While building an agent is an achievement, ensuring it performs well in real-world, scalable scenarios is where the real test begins.Maxim AI's approach to AI-powered simulations and evaluation is a game-changer. The ability to simulate interactions, measure quality, trace multi-agent workflows, and debug in real time is exactly what teams need to fine-tune their AI models.

comments.content: The dashboard for some reason reminded me of Kibana UI. Good job indeed.On a different note, why do you think unit tests are not sufficient? Should integration tests perform better? I mean the simulation test should be the most costly test from the testing paradigm in terms of feedback loop and execution time , can we do better in the lower level tests too?
